channel.title: Ask us
channel.description: post questions you've always wanted to ask about the client here without fear of [s]religious[/s] persecution and those who are knowledgeable of the client may be able to respond.

item.title: Ask us
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:109, topic:352058”]Information isn’t illegal, why would Jagex hunt them down?

If i released some code or detailed analysis on the workings of the client, Jagex wouldnt come after me. They really dont care too much about macro’s anymore… look at the game I would say 70% of online players are bots.

Source: when RSBuddy went down 50k players went offline.[/quote]

True story, I’d let people cheat in my game if I received 50k+ * 5-10USD/mo.

Read full topic

item.title: Ask us
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Information isn’t illegal, why would Jagex hunt them down?

If i released some code or detailed analysis on the workings of the client, Jagex wouldnt come after me. They really dont care too much about macro’s anymore… look at the game I would say 70% of online players are bots.

Source: when RSBuddy went down 50k players went offline.

Read full topic

item.title: Ask us
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:107, topic:352058”][quote author=mutex_ link=topic=448411.msg3614097#msg3614097 date=1306827107]

most people believe that the [very little] information they know makes them special, as such are unwilling to
[/quote]Some are also scared that if they release what [very little] information they know, they will apparently get hunted down by Jagex.

I disagree, its just they do not know and like to pretend.[/quote]My point is just as probable as yours.

Read full topic

item.title: Ask us
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“mutex_, post:103, topic:352058”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=448411.msg3613916#msg3613916 date=1306813239]
most people believe that the [very little] information they know makes them special, as such are unwilling to
[/quote]Some are also scared that if they release what [very little] information they know, they will apparently get hunted down by Jagex.[/quote]

I disagree, its just they do not know and like to pretend.

Read full topic

item.title: Ask us
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

objectdef is a name for a representation of the definition of a specific type of object entity, complete with name, actions, model reference, etc.
the object1-5 are “objects” in the sense they are entities of a scene… they represent characters, projectiles, ornaments, and other various kinds
landscape files have not i believe changed very much since 317, as i recall they store a 64x64x4 grid of tiles. in the past map_idx was used as a resolution table to map between region coordinates (in the form of a uid/hash, (y << 8) | x iirc) and “type” (map (tiles) vs landscape (objects)) to the corresponding cached resource files (main_file_cache.dat & idx5). now however they use a higher-level interface for cached resources and use base-31 encoded names for look up (mX_Y, lX_Y, nX_Y, umX_Y, ulX_Y) as well as support npc spawn maps and the under-water maps as well. the structure itself has not changed drastically afaik minus accommodating for new parameters in the game engine and variable region sizes

Read full topic

item.title: Ask us
item.dc:creator: @jenora jenora
item.description:
@jenora wrote:

Sorry if this question is very vague but what kind of objects are the static objects in regions like walls and such? In the client I have there’s Object1 through to Object5, what are the differences between them and do they also have an ObjectDef?

Also, have landscape files changed much since 317?

Read full topic

item.title: Ask us
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

i’m going to guess its some sort of image or raster class

Read full topic

item.title: Ask us
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

Why have people ask questions when people could collaborate on building an in-depth detailed documentation?

Read full topic

[code] public static void method501(double d, byte byte0) {

else

double d9 = col + 0.33333333333333331D;
if (d9 > 1.0D)
d9–;

if (cb < 0.0D)
cb++;
if (6D * d9 < 1.0D)
r_perc = d8 + (new_sat - d8) * 6D * d9;
else if (2D * d9 < 1.0D)
r_perc = new_sat;
else if (3D * d9 < 2D)

else

else if (2D * col < 1.0D)

else if (3D * col < 2D)

else

else if (2D * cb < 1.0D)
b_perc = new_sat;
else if (3D * cb < 2D)
b_perc = d8 + (new_sat - d8) * (0.66666666666666663D - cb) * 6D;
else
b_perc = d8;
}
int new_r = (int) (r_perc * 256D);

item.title: Ask us
item.dc:creator: @jenora jenora
item.description:
@jenora wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:96, topic:352058”][quote author=Stale Milk link=topic=448411.msg3608045#msg3608045 date=1306287961]
317 client
[/quote][quote author=jenora link=topic=448411.msg3609481#msg3609481 date=1306435329]
In the 317 client where is the 65,536 colour palette stored/created? I need to get an RGB colour from a 2 byte lookup value.
[/quote]

Those questions belong on MoparScape.[/quote]

Then you clearly don’t understand my question, this is a client related question.

The client version is irrelevant to my question anyway, I just needed to know how they generated this table.

[quote=“super_, post:97, topic:352058”][quote author=jenora link=topic=448411.msg3609481#msg3609481 date=1306435329]
In the 317 client where is the 65,536 colour palette stored/created? I need to get an RGB colour from a 2 byte lookup value.
[/quote]

Colour palette for what? Do you mean the gradient tables?[/quote]

Well models store a 2 byte value per triangle that references into a colour table of sorts.

I think I have found it though, method372 in the texture class (which I think is also used to change brightness) creates a table of these colours that models use to colour themselves.

Read full topic

item.title: Ask us
item.dc:creator: @unlimitedorb unlimitedorb
item.description:
@unlimitedorb wrote:

One thing I haven’t seen bots take advantage of is audio. All kinds of events are communicated with audio which stays more or less constant through updates. Events like when an item has been banked, whether or not you’re being attacked, etc.

Read full topic
